docs.snippet: Hosts John Eligon and Rachel Swarns spoke with two women of color, adopted by families of a different race, about their experiences.

headline.print_headline: Adoption Across Racial and Ethnic Lines: ‘These Relationships Are Always Going to Be in Flux’
headline.main: Adoption Across Racial and Ethnic Lines: ‘These Relationships Are Always Going to Be in Flux’

docs.snippet: The Philippines and Malaysia said on Monday they will look into whether Uber Technologies' [UBER.UL] move to sell its Southeast Asian business to ride-hailing rival Grab hinders competition, days after Singapore began a probe into the deal on simi...

headline.print_headline: Philippines, Malaysia Put Uber-Grab Deal Under Anti-Competition Scrutiny
headline.main: Philippines, Malaysia Put Uber-Grab Deal Under Anti-Competition Scrutiny

docs.snippet: “King In the Wilderness” looks at a lesser-known period of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s life. And “The Good Karma Hospital” returns.

headline.main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘King in the Wilderness’ and ‘The Good Karma Hospital’

docs.snippet: An exhibition that reproduces the precious treasures of Mughal art in their original setting in Kabul's Babur Garden opened this weekend, bringing a rare moment of cultural relief to a city pounded by war for decades.

headline.print_headline: Rare Kabul Exhibition Brings Taste of Mughal Art Back Home
headline.main: Rare Kabul Exhibition Brings Taste of Mughal Art Back Home

docs.snippet: Celebrate International Women’s Day with a superhero and an Olympian. And “Atlanta” takes on the pitfalls of fame.

headline.main: What’s on TV Thursday: ‘Jessica Jones’ and ‘Atlanta’

docs.snippet: Alastair Cook's third successive dismissal to New Zealand left-armer Trent Boult on Friday will undoubtedly raise questions as to whether the former captain may look to end his illustrious career.

headline.print_headline: Cook's Slump Continues, Questions About Retirement Again Likely
headline.main: Cook's Slump Continues, Questions About Retirement Again Likely

docs.snippet: The genetic mutation arose 7,300 years ago in just one person in West Africa, scientists reported on Thursday. Its advantage: a shield against rampant malaria.

headline.print_headline: A Sprawling Tale of a Cell Mutation
headline.main: How One Child’s Sickle Cell Mutation Helped Protect the World From Malaria

docs.snippet: Last week, the Afghan air force dropped its first laser-guided missile on a Taliban compound in Farah, the western Afghan province that has seen increasing fighting since the beginning of the year.

headline.print_headline: As Afghan Forces Squeeze in Helmand, Taliban Focus Shifts
headline.main: As Afghan Forces Squeeze in Helmand, Taliban Focus Shifts

docs.snippet: Mr. Borders covered Nigeria, Canada, India and Britain before taking senior editing positions at the newspaper in a 46-year career there.

headline.main: William Borders, Former Times Reporter and Editor, Dies at 79

docs.snippet: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton roared to a record seventh pole at the season-opening Australian Grand Prix on Saturday, blitzing the field in his Mercedes with a blazing lap at Albert Park.

headline.print_headline: Motor Racing: Brilliant Hamilton Blazes to Melbourne Pole
headline.main: Motor Racing: Brilliant Hamilton Blazes to Melbourne Pole
